description: A fatal disease affecting the palm's central bud, leading to discoloration and decay. Often has a foul smell.
Characterized by the dropping of young coconuts (buttons) and the decay of the root system near the bud.
Caused by the fungus Pestalotiopsis palmarum, it appears as grayish-white spots on the leaves, leading to reduced photosynthesis.
The youngest leaves blacken and rot, especially during rainy seasons. If left untreated, it can spread to the bud and kill the palm.
A reddish-brown or black liquid oozes from cracks in the trunk. It's a symptom of fungal infection that can weaken the tree.
